This software-based protocol determination technique allows for the same mirror system to be used in different vehicles with varying output protocols. By utilizing a microcomputer and adjusting parameters based on vehicle operation, the system can accurately determine the protocol of the vehicle control output. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, specifically focusing on front wheel brakes. The system includes an anti-dive device in the front suspension to control the contraction of the front fork in response to braking force. The anti-dive device helps minimize chassis vibration and improve braking efficiency by increasing the grounding load on the front wheel. The system also includes an anti-lock control unit to regulate hydraulic pressure to prevent wheel lock. The system operates by sensing nearly-locked conditions of the front wheel and adjusting hydraulic pressure accordingly. The anti-dive device works in conjunction with the anti-lock control unit to enhance braking performance. The system is designed to provide efficient and stable braking for motorcycles, particularly those with high centers of gravity and short wheelbases. Overall, the invention aims to improve safety and performance of motorcycle braking systems. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an improved partition system for refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers, allowing for the separation of cargo areas into different temperature zones. The system includes panels that can be independently moved and stowed, reducing the volume of air that needs to be temperature controlled and increasing efficiency. The panels can be slidably attached to rails, hingedly attached to trolley assemblies, and raised into a stowed position when not in use. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve designed for use in liquid chromatography to separate and purify biological macromolecules. The valve features a unique diaphragm seal that allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly. The valve is intended for use in processes such as counterflow simulated moving bed chromatography for efficient separation and purification of pharmaceuticals. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays, incorporating directional thrust valves for higher efficiency operation. The assembly includes circular disc valves with wider frontal legs to divert liquid flow around the aperture, reducing back-trapping and promoting directional thrust of vapor. The design enhances tray efficiency by reducing retrograde flow, increasing valve density, and facilitating controlled liquid and vapor flow for improved mass transfer in process columns. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It aims to reduce variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure, is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a vane pump to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power. The vane motor drives a generator to produce electricity, which can be used for various applications. Alternative embodiments include using the assembly in a gas grill, scuba diving gear, or a vehicle driven by pressurized fluid. The invention allows for the extraction of work from pressurized fluid while reducing pressure, potentially reducing the need for larger or more expensive regulators.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a pallet system designed to support and secure trays loaded with items for shipping. The pallet system includes raised guide rails to prevent lateral movement of the trays, end stops to limit longitudinal movement, and end plates for added stability and protection. The system allows for easy loading and unloading of trays, and can be customized for different types of loads. Components of the system can be made from various materials and manufacturing methods to suit specific needs. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts. The design focuses on compact structure, reasonable layout, high efficiency, and easy control of the rotary-wing system. The magnetic suspension system includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and guide rail. The rotary-wing system is designed to avoid contact and friction within the saucer shell, reduce noise and vibration, and increase power conversion efficiency. Two improvement solutions are proposed to overcome reactive torque: coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings. The electric engine of the flying saucer is based on a permanent magnet synchronous motor. The design also includes a radial magnetic suspension structure and an axial magnetic suspension structure for the rotary-wing wheels. The flying saucer can provide lift and thrust with stability and enhanced power performance. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced using recombinant DNA technology. These muteins are used for isolating, purifying, and determining biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins. The muteins have mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, resulting in higher binding affinity compared to wild-type streptavidin. The invention also includes methods for production, purification, and detection of proteins using these muteins, as well as reagent kits containing them. </summary>

<summary> The invention involves methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, with preferred catalysts including nickel-boride, nickel-phosphide, aluminum-nickel, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina. The reactions result in high yields of guanidines from various guanylating agents and amines, with the nickel catalysts being recoverable and reusable.</summary>

The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires, providing colored oxide coatings with excellent weatherability. The process involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire in an anodic oxidation bath, then electrolytically coloring the anodized coating in a separate bath. The thickness of the oxide film formed during anodization is crucial for achieving desired colors. The apparatus includes baths for degreasing, etching, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing, with the aluminum strip or wire continuously passing through each bath. By controlling the electrolytic conditions and bath compositions, various colors can be obtained with high efficiency and stability.

The invention describes a process for assembling a DNA sequence of interest in planta from precursor vectors, allowing for efficient and rapid transformation of plant cells with desired genetic sequences. This method enables the selection of transgenic plants expressing specific functions of interest, providing a versatile and flexible approach for genetic transformation in plants.

<summary> The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by applying a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate to reduce frictional wear. The coating is made of a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load bearing additive, bonded directly to the aluminum surface. The coating allows for the use of lower cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency. The coating process does not require high surface finishing or electroplating, making it cost-effective. Experimental results show that the coated swash plates have higher seizure loads and lower friction coefficients compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates. The coating provides a durable and low friction surface for swash plates in automotive air conditioning systems. </summary>

The present invention relates to organic polymers for anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for preventing light reflection during photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources. The polymers are designed to absorb light at specific wavelengths and can be used to form a layer that eliminates standing wave effects and reflection/diffraction in lithography processes. The invention provides novel chemical compounds, preparation methods, anti-reflective coating compositions, and methods for forming anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor wafers. The polymers are cross-linked to form stable coatings, and when used in submicro-pattern formation processes, they improve product yield by eliminating CD variations and ensuring stable pattern formation. The polymers have high solubility in hydrocarbon solvents, but become insoluble after hard-baking, making them ideal for use in photoresist films without causing cutting or footing issues.

<summary> The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic. The film comprises white pigment, flame retardant, and UV absorber, providing good orientability, thermoformability, optical, and mechanical properties. The film can be produced cost-effectively and is suitable for outdoor applications. The film passes fire tests and has high UV resistance. The film is produced using masterbatch technology and precrystallization. The film can be recycled without loss of properties. Thermoforming of the film is possible without predrying. The film is suitable for a variety of applications and exhibits excellent performance after weathering and heat-conditioning tests.</summary>

<summary> The present invention describes a method for producing 143a by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis. The process achieves very high conversion and selectivity for 143a, exceeding 99%. Various catalysts, including CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3, are used to efficiently convert 142b to 143a. The process can also remove olefinic byproducts, such as 1130a, 1131a, and 1132a, from the final product. Adiabatic reactors are employed to carry out the hydrofluorination process at different temperatures and pressures. The results demonstrate successful removal of olefins and high purity of the final product, 143a. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a process for deacylation and desulfurization of compounds to improve product yield and reduce impurities. Pyrazolotriazoles are difficult to synthesize but are useful in photographic products. The process involves reacting compounds with hypophosphorous acid to reduce elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities. The use of hypophosphorous acid increases product yield and purity. The process is conducted at specific temperatures and pressures, with the addition of catalytic acids. The compounds used as starting materials and intermediates have inert substituents, which are stable and non-reactive. The process can be adapted for various compounds and reactions, providing significant advantages in terms of efficiency and product quality.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots. The method involves measuring the total quantity of fiber in each lot, determining a partial quantity to be removed, and continuously removing only the calculated quantity from each lot. The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to ensure precise removal of fiber quantities. The method eliminates fiber residuals, ensures an optimally homogeneous mixture, and can be time-controlled to maintain a predetermined schedule for fiber removal.</summary>

<summary> The present invention is directed to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel yarn courses, achieved through the use of rake systems to overlap yarns in successive courses. The invention allows for greater control of fabric density and uniformity, particularly in structural applications where the fabric is impregnated with resin for added strength. </summary>

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom by adjusting the air pressure to produce appropriate weft carrying forces for each weft thread, thereby preventing wasteful consumption of pressurized air. Different weft carrying forces are achieved by varying the air pressure, nozzle spacing, orifice diameter, and ejection timing, resulting in stable weft insertion and reduced air consumption.

<summary> The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving the fibres to improve flexibility and reduce breakage rates. The process includes steps such as opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning the fibres into yarn, with variations in temperature, humidity, and duration of health preservation. Experiments with different types of bast fibres and blends with other fibres show a significant reduction in end breakage rates, improving work efficiency and product quality. The invention aims to provide a simple and efficient process for producing bast fibre yarn with low end breakage rates, enhancing the spinnability of bast fibres and resulting in more flexible products. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, particularly in papermaking, to measure and remove rotational variability from the nip pressure profile. The invention involves placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to measure pressure as it enters the nip region. By averaging the pressure readings from corresponding sensors at each position, a more accurate nip pressure profile can be calculated. Different configurations of sensors, such as pairs spaced 180Â° apart or multiple sets spaced 120Â° or 90Â° apart, can be used to compensate for rotational variability. The system includes a transmitter unit for wireless data transmission, a high-resolution signal processor, and a process control unit for real-time correction of pressure distribution. Graphical displays show the effectiveness of different sensor configurations in reducing rotational variability and improving the accuracy of the nip pressure profile. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board. The apparatus includes a clamp for securing it to the ironing board, a flexible cord support for supporting the electrical cord of an iron, and a detachable article holder. The clamp has a threaded bolt for adjusting the clamp's position on the ironing board. The cord support has a flexible mast with a spring section and a foot for pivotable movement. The article holder has a circular hoop with support bars and vertical supports for holding articles. The apparatus also includes an electrical outlet for the iron's plug. The cord support and article holder can be detached for storage. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that allows the operator to select the length of a buttonhole to be sewn. The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with springs defining an initial position, and an adjustable stop for controlling the length of the buttonhole. The device operates by actuating a tripping lever on the machine to sew the buttonhole in two stages, with top bar stitches and left leg zig-zag stitches followed by bottom bar stitches and right leg zig-zag stitches. The operator can adjust the stop to ensure the buttonhole stitches close without overlap, based on the type of material being sewn. By using a sample material and adjusting the stop accordingly, the operator can achieve perfect buttonholes in different fabrics. The invention provides a precise and effective way to sew buttonholes regardless of the material being used.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid solution. The apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The textile web is spread out and guided through a dwell loop to increase the contact time of the liquid with the substances to be removed. The apparatus allows for effective washing without stacking the fabric, making it suitable for various materials including knitted fabrics. Different embodiments of the apparatus are described, each designed to improve the washing effect and maintain low tension in the textile web. The compact and efficient design of the apparatus allows for improved fabric treatment without compromising the quality of the material.</summary>

<summary> The source document describes a dry cleaning machine with separate air flow and solvent flow systems. The air flow system prevents solvent vapors from escaping when the door is opened by drawing in ambient air. The solvent flow system includes a filtration process and a refrigeration system to reclaim solvent vapors. The machine also has controls for a "cartridge dry" operation to dry filter cartridges. The refrigeration system is used to cool the solvent in the storage tank and condense solvent vapors during the drying portion of the cycle. The controls include a timer, door switch, and a "cartridge dry" switch to manually initiate the drying process for filter cartridges. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an improved method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly in the production of melt spun nonwoven webs. The system involves a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width, providing good control of cross-machine uniformity. The method allows for easy adjustment of filament denier and results in improved web formation uniformity and isotropicity. The invention offers advantages over conventional systems in terms of spinning speed, energy consumption, machine cleanliness, web uniformity, and process control. </summary>

<summary> The source document discusses various embodiments of a sewing machine system that allows users to easily specify a sewing position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen. In the first embodiment, the sewing machine includes receivers to detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from the pen, enabling precise identification of the specified position. The second embodiment introduces an embroidery unit with receivers attached to the carriage, providing flexibility in positioning the receivers for accurate detection. The third embodiment eliminates the need for a cable connection by using an electromagnetic wave output circuit in the pen and an electromagnetic wave detector in the sewing machine. The fourth embodiment adds an additional receiver on the pillar of the sewing machine, allowing for improved accuracy in identifying the specified position on the work cloth.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by applying functional additives such as ultraviolet protection and anti-bacterial properties. The preparations consist of a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder as carriers for the functional additives. The wool particles are pulverized into ultrafine powder to enhance their carrying and retention capabilities. Additionally, a preparation comprising bamboo fiber powder is also described for improving moisture management properties of fabrics. Methods for preparing these preparations involve pulverizing the wool or bamboo fibers, forming suspensions, and adding functional additives. The preparations are applied to fabric materials through printing, padding, or foam application methods, resulting in enhanced ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle resistance properties. The treated fabrics show improved ultraviolet protection, wicking, and wrinkle recovery, as well as enhanced anti-bacterial properties. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts. It utilizes two separate computers to control the sewing machine functions and the frame table movements independently, simplifying the reprogramming process. The system also includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, improving efficiency and accuracy in quilting operations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, using hydroentanglement on an imaging surface. The fabric is made from two precursor webs with different fibrous matrices, separated by a fluid-pervious support layer to control fiber distribution. The method involves pre-entangling the precursor webs, then subjecting them to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device. The resulting fabric exhibits a pronounced image on one side and specific physical characteristics on the other, suitable for various consumer applications. The fabric may also include apertures and can be used in products like hygiene articles, medical gauze, wipes, protective wear, and apparel. Modifications and variations can be made within the scope of the claims.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, using control means actuated by the strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine. The device ensures continuous operation, allowing for the sewing of relatively stiff strips of material and being insensitive to disturbances. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments, such as sweaters and tank tops, without the need for separate sewing processes, resulting in a seamless and cost-effective manufacturing process. The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds, overlaying loops at the end portions, and gradually binding them off to join the pieces seamlessly. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, comprising stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material. A production line is described for embedding the cables in the material, ensuring precise orientation and adhesion. The method involves preheating the cables, sheathing them in the extruder with liquefied plastic, and cooling the resulting traction element. The traction elements are used for lifting and pulling loads, meeting high safety requirements. The production line allows for precise positioning of the cables in the jacket, resulting in high-quality traction elements. </summary>

The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, designed to minimize hindrance to the guiding and pull-back of the needle thread loop. The arrangement includes cams, a spring rod, and a capsule release device to facilitate smooth movement of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing. By strategically placing the holding means on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, the needle thread loop can be expanded and pulled back without significant resistance. The design allows for jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, resulting in improved sewing properties.

<summary> The invention pertains to the synthesis of silicon-based nanowires and composites using liquid silane inks in an electrospinning process. Different formulations of inks were used, including three-component inks with polymers and accelerants, and five-component inks with solid phases. The resulting nanowires were characterized after thermal or laser treatment, showing the formation of amorphous and crystalline silicon materials. The produced materials were tested as anodes in lithium ion batteries, demonstrating promising initial capacity and cycling performance. Overall, the methods provide a novel approach to producing silicon-based nanowires for various applications. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is directed to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel using a braking system adjustable by a tensioning lever biased by the departing thread. The arrangement allows for individual and centralized control of thread tension in the creel. By utilizing pneumatic biasing arrangements and electromagnetic brakes, the tensioning lever can be adjusted to achieve the desired thread tension and provide rapid braking action when needed. </summary>

The present invention is a sewing machine detector that overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors by providing a durable, compact, and stress-reducing design. It includes light shielding discs, optical fiber supporters, and power indicating optical fibers to accurately detect sewing machine control signals without interference.

<summary> The invention is a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through specific critical operations including completion of coagulation and treatment with water of non-alkaline pH. The process simplifies traditional treatments, accelerates production, and results in yarn with a high degree of whiteness using simple and economical means. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a deaeration tank for washing pulp after oxygen bleaching, designed to remove oxygen entrained in the pulp to prevent foam formation in the washer. The tank is small, with an inlet pipe, outlet, and tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration. The system utilizes filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid in the tank. The tank is cylindrical, with specific dimensions for the inlet pipe, outlet, and filtrate inlet. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor, and the velocity of the filtrate entering the tank is regulated for efficient deaeration. Mounting brackets and a platform are included for installation. </summary>

The invention relates to composite materials and their properties, particularly biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composites. BTR composites are designed to have high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The invention is a new material concept that focuses on maximizing out-of-plane stiffness. The composite structure includes fiber, stuffer, and joint components that work together for reinforcement. The BTR composite is versatile and can be used in various applications, including military and industrial uses. The material design process involves defining functions and quantifying objectives to optimize the material for specific tasks. Overall, the invention introduces a new material concept that offers structural performance improvements.

<summary> The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events. The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads and can be easily replaced after deformation. The device is designed to prevent extensive damage to structures during seismic events. Various geometries and shapes of the device can be used for different bracing configurations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities in existing buildings. The bedroom cabinet is assembled in a box shape with an outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength. Boxes for devices and shelves for belongings are integrated within the cabinet without protruding. The outer surfaces are flat, allowing for multiple cabinets to be stacked or installed adjacent to each other. A clearance between the outer and inner casings houses wiring and provides ventilation. Spacer members with vent grooves enhance air flow and sound-proofing throughout the cabinet. The cabinet includes features such as a curtain rail, TV shelf, backrest, and storage compartments. The assembly process involves fitting the inner casing into the outer casing and securing with clip members and an ornamental web. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in construction sites to provide safety barriers. The guard rail support includes a base plate, upright column, rail supporting brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring. The system allows for easy assembly and disassembly of guard railings, meets safety guidelines, and can be used efficiently by workers. A concrete-filled steel base is also provided for additional stability when anchoring to a floor is not possible. The system can be used to construct safety barriers with wooden rails or mesh-like fences to prevent falls at construction sites. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery. Various categories of methods for stimulating reservoirs are discussed, including electrical, heating, mechanical fracturing, and acoustic methods. The invention extends the effective range of stimulation by using multiple pulse sources in multiple wells and adjusting frequencies to target specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir. The invention also includes methods for separating components of the recovered fluids, such as hydrocarbons, gases, water, and impurities. Different separation processes, such as membrane separation, fractionation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction, may be used to separate components like CO2, H2S, heavy metals, and other impurities from the recovered fluids. The invention also addresses electrode wear in electrohydraulic devices and includes improvements for electrode longevity. Overall, the invention provides a comprehensive approach to enhancing oil recovery and processing recovered fluids from oil-bearing reservoirs.</summary>

The document describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, allowing for the connection of multiple grid-strips to create a composite soil reinforcing element. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to secure transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, preventing lateral movement and providing additional tensile strength to the structure.

<summary> The invention relates to a plow blade design with fluid passage and ejection points for wetting the ground during utility installation. Different embodiments show variations in the placement of the fluid tube and the method of fluid ejection along the blade. The design allows for controlled fluid flow rates and locations, providing lubrication to reduce friction during plowing. The components are assembled using basic manufacturing processes, allowing for easy customization to match specific job requirements. Overall, the invention offers a cost-effective and efficient solution for wetting the ground during utility installation. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction, allowing for panels of greater dimensions without movement joints. The system includes battens, mesh reinforcement, plaster matrix, and various flashings for openings. The system meets building code requirements for structural integrity, durability, fire resistance, and external moisture protection. Components such as battens, mesh, plaster, and flashings are specified for use in the system.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a safe with a door structure that allows for secure locking and protection against forceful intrusion attempts. The safe can be constructed with a liner and concrete, or as a preassembled steel safe, providing a simple yet effective design for protecting valuables. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations at desired depths. Traditional methods involve standpipes or pressure transducers cemented into boreholes, but these can be influenced by pressures in the formation above and below. The new method involves cementing a conduit with a filter at the desired depth, clearing the filter of grout, and creating a fluid connection to the formation. This allows for more precise measurement of formation pressures without interference from pressures at other depths in the borehole. The method can be applied to various reservoir types and allows for the installation of multiple sensors in a single cementing operation. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member. It aims to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensure smooth vehicle traveling, and absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction. The structure includes steps with elastic members mounted inside, a joint block across the expansion gap, and supporting blocks. By adjusting the shear modulus of the elastic members, the expansion gaps can be made uniform, reducing the occurrence of tire issues. The method involves joining the elastic members, fixing them in place, and deforming them to absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction. Overall, the invention provides a solution for safe and smooth vehicle traveling on bridge girders and road bridges.</summary>

The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment. Traditional methods of cooling cooked meat products using chilled air cause dehydration and slow heat transfer. The invention aims to use a fluid treatment chamber with a brine solution for quick heat transfer and recirculation. Overhead rail systems have limitations, so wheeled floor trucks are preferred, but their wheels can contaminate the solution. The enclosed floor track system prevents contamination by segregating the wheels from the treatment solution. Two embodiments are described, one for horizontally axled hand trucks and another for hand trucks with downwardly depending struts. The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving resources and providing economic advantages.

<summary> The lock device of the present invention prevents a work machine from tilting by locking the boom to the main body using an engaging member and an engaged member. The lock device is easy to operate manually and prevents damage to the members by providing guide members and a slip-prevention plate. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for adjustable suction efficiency. The device includes adjustment mechanisms on the vacuum head to regulate the spacing between the suction portion and the pool bottom. This adjustment feature allows for real-time regulation of suction without needing to adjust the suction source. The invention can also be added as a kit to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modifications required. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools, providing a retriever section that can be mounted onto a drill string independently of threading on the pipe. The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement, ensuring successful retrieval of the wear bushing without damage. Different embodiments, such as one with a threaded retriever section, offer flexibility in retrieving wear bushings during drilling operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows passage for wireline or other tools to pass through and can be closed by landing a plug on a seat. The tool features modular stacked piston units to increase power delivery to the stuck object. The dump valve is annularly disposed to prevent slamming against a seat during cycling. The tool can be activated by dropping a plug into the passage to seal it. The valve opens and closes without impacts, allowing for longer trouble-free service. The design eliminates cyclical impacts on the valve and allows for forces to stay in phase with the oscillating string or fish. The tool can operate with or without impacts on each cycle, depending on the applied overpull. It can be used in stimulation or fishing operations and provides large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string. The tool may also have a rotational lock between the mandrel and housing for torque transmission. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and integral counterfort for increased stability. The system includes a precast base and a connection between the face panel and base using grout and rebar. The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, saving on installation and transportation costs. Additional features include drainage openings, shear keys, and options for stability enhancements such as H-piles or impact barriers. The system provides flexibility in customization and installation, making it a versatile solution for retaining soil or other materials. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of oil or gas wells to improve production. The invention addresses shortcomings in conventional down hole heating systems by focusing heat where it is needed and protecting electrical components from damage. The system includes a heating unit with insulated electrical connections, heat insulating packers, and stainless steel collars to contain and focus heat in the production zone. The method involves using the system to treat oil or gas wells with high viscosity or paraffin blockage conditions to increase flow rates. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, especially those that are stuck or lost. It includes an external pull tool or overshot and an internal pull tool or spear, both with a catch mechanism for locking and unlocking. The mechanism allows for controlled connection and disconnection with objects in the well bore without the need for jarring or mechanical vibration. The overshot mechanism includes a collet structure for gripping objects, while the internal pull tool includes a spear slip structure. Both mechanisms have a latching control element with guide pins and spring elements for selective latching and unlatching. The mechanisms can be used repeatedly without the need for resetting, making them efficient for various down hole service operations. </summary>

<summary> The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability. The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. Multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, glue, and clamps, are used to assemble the substrates to prevent deformation and detachment. The goal is to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the floors. The example embodiment aims to provide longer life and allow for corrective maintenance of the floors. The use of specific glazes and reinforcement means enhances the durability of the composed stave floors. The method addresses drawbacks of conventional stave floors, such as deformation and detachment issues. Overall, the example embodiment offers a solution for improving the quality and longevity of composed stave floors. </summary>

The invention relates to ladder attachments designed to improve stability, prevent damage to work surfaces, and allow ladders to straddle corners. The attachments include large contact area braces with resilient pads, U-bolts, and clamps to secure the ladder in place. By increasing contact area, preventing slipping, and allowing for corner straddling, the attachments enhance the safety and functionality of ladders during various tasks.

<summary> The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, providing increased adhesion and reducing debris generation during driving. The collation system includes collar portions that encircle the fastener shanks and connecting portions between adjacent collars. Various configurations, such as tapered collars, embossed patterns, and preferentially weakened regions, are used to influence separation of the connecting portions at desired locations. The collation system also includes features such as thin bridges, stiff ribs, and deformations on the nail shanks to enhance penetration into the substrate and reduce debris. Overall, the collation system aims to minimize debris generation, increase holding power, and provide structural integrity during fastener driving.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. It consists of a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button for precise sealant application. The design allows for manual or automated sealant injection. The injection button has channels and orifices for accurate sealant dispersion. The device is versatile and can be used with cartridges or injection machines. It simplifies sealing operations, improves efficiency, and enhances the quality of sealant application. The design also allows for easy transition to applying sealing cords or filler sealants. Overall, the invention provides a more economical and efficient sealing process. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a position sensor signal conditioner and monitoring system for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy consumption. The sensor includes a waveform generator and error correction generator to modify sensing signals and eliminate unwanted static signals, providing accurate position information. The system constantly compares sensor output to a desired minimum value and adjusts for changes, allowing for efficient and reliable operation with minimal power consumption. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines, offering variable valve displacement without the need for springs. The system allows for precise control of valve timing and opening percentage, resulting in improved engine performance and fuel efficiency. By eliminating the need for springs and reducing valve mass inertia, the system provides a more efficient and effective means of controlling valve operation in internal combustion engines. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, with a light member having a housing, lighting control region, and switch for controlling different colors of light. The light member can also be used for lighting underneath cabinets, with the ability to add modules and control the color and intensity of the light. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade. Traditional flow deflection apparatuses use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures. The invention introduces separate inserts, rather than cast separating walls, to improve cooling efficiency and reduce thermal stresses. The inserts are guided and secured within the apparatus using holders, simplifying assembly and attachment. The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape to direct cooling fluid flow. The use of inserts allows for flexibility in design and easy adjustment of the cooling system. The invention is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, reducing weight and simplifying production. The separating walls can be connected to the apparatus through integral material joints for added security.</summary>

<summary> The present invention is a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall. The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to provide optimal throttle settings, and can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission for improved vehicle performance. </summary>

<summary> This invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste. Conventional hog fuel burners have been inefficient and polluting, requiring frequent cleaning and maintenance. The waste fuel burner described in the document aims to emit minimal particulate materials within environmental regulations. It can effectively burn wet wood with high moisture content and produce little slag or clinkers. The burner operates by forming a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel. The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber with swirl air, then complete combustion occurs in a secondary chamber with tangentially introduced air. The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to load changes. It can burn fuels with varying moisture content and types, producing clean exhaust gases suitable for various industrial applications. The burner design minimizes clinker formation, reduces the need for excess air, and allows for quick adjustments in fuel feed and air supply to meet heat demand. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration for air conditioning, utilizing a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream. The system recirculates return air from the load for evaporation, achieving sensible cooling without adding water vapor to the useful air. The apparatus includes an array of vertically directed tubular members for efficient cooling, with specific construction details provided for maximum efficiency. A hybrid system is also described, incorporating a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a portion of the air stream and dehumidify it. The composite system achieves high efficiency and reduced energy consumption compared to traditional vapor compression units. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir. Each pump head contains an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads. The fluid flows through conduits in each pump head and is combined into a single flow before exiting. The pump heads are connected by combiners to facilitate fluid flow between them. The pump can be mounted on different support structures such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer. The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance, with the ability to add more pump heads for increased operating pressure. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving engine robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of cylinders, each having a movable piston and connected to hydraulically and mechanically actuated devices. A portion of the cylinders have engine compression release brakes connected to the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system includes a solenoid, valve members, and a piston to control the opening and closing of the exhaust valve during engine braking. The engine control module determines the need for engine braking and activates the engine brakes for the desired cylinders. The engine brakes operate by blocking high pressure fluid flow to open the exhaust valve, allowing air to be vented during the compression stroke of the piston. The modularity of the engine brake system allows for customization of braking horsepower and cost efficiency for different applications. Overall, the invention provides a flexible and efficient engine compression release brake system for improved engine performance. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine and an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events. The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the links, allowing for translation and damping of extreme shocks. The pin serves as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads, while the radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy. This design prevents damage to the gearbox and attached peripherals, without the need for all components to withstand extreme loads, and allows for easy replacement of the pin during maintenance. </summary>

The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balancing arrow shafts. The invention includes a point cap system for adjustable weight balance, a balance pin for arrow shaft balance, and means for attaching points without allowing dirt to enter the shaft. The invention also includes a point adaptor, a nock cap adaptor, and a method for uniformly capping the end of an arrow shaft.

<summary> The invention is a pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training. It utilizes an electronically controlled system with a plastic expendable housing pyrotechnic charges. The system includes an electrical ignition system, a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon, and an electrical control circuit for automatic and semi-automatic fire. The circuitry consists of various functional blocks such as bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and MILES interface. The system simulates small arms fire noise and flash realistically, providing cost-effective and reliable training using actual weapons. The plastic expendable contains pyrotechnic charges sealed in cups, which are ignited by heating a bridge wire to produce combustion by-products and simulate small arms fire. The system is designed to be reusable, low maintenance, and safe, providing a realistic training experience for combat troops. The detailed description includes the block diagram of the electrical control circuit, the schematic diagram, and illustrations of the expendable and firing unit. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines, aiming to improve engine performance and reduce intake noise. It includes a tank, two pipes connecting the tank to the intake passage, and a valve controlled by engine load. The first pipe has a larger cross-sectional area than the intake passage, while the second pipe has a smaller area and opens closer to the air cleaner. A vacuum actuator controls the valve, optimizing engine performance by adjusting the effective pipe length. The narrow passage in the second pipe acts as a resonator, reducing intake noise. The valve operation is based on engine speed and load, ensuring optimal performance at different operating conditions. The valve is closed at low loads and speeds, and opened at higher loads and speeds. The control circuit stores operating conditions based on engine speed and throttle position sensors. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures. It allows for easy installation by one person and can be used on surfaces of different sizes. The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with tapered springs guiding them together. The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and secured with screws for permanent use. For pole mounting, adapters and a clamp assembly are used to secure the bracket to the pole. A speaker mounting bracket can be attached to the adjustable bracket for mounting speakers. Overall, the invention provides a simple and efficient solution for mounting objects in various settings. </summary>

<summary> The present disclosure relates to a burner for heat utilizing appliances, with a focus on efficiency and clean burning. The burner includes a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. A shroud provides a second wall for tertiary combustion air and an external surface cool enough to avoid burns. The burner also features legs, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover for safety and convenience. Modular heat utilizing appliances can be removably coupled to the burner, including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The system allows for versatility and efficiency in various heat utilizing applications. </summary>

<summary> Rotary internal combustion engines face challenges with cooling systems and spark plug arrangements to prevent structural failures. The invention focuses on improving cooling characteristics and reducing thermal distortion in the housing surrounding spark plug bosses. By staggering the spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway, high velocity flow is controlled and heat transfer coefficients are increased. Tests show that the staggered configuration improves flow regime and heat transfer rates compared to in-line arrangements. Overall, the invention aims to maintain efficient combustion while enhancing cooling capabilities in rotary engines. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing by using control valve positions as feedback. The method maintains total mass flow through parallel valves constant to minimize steam boiler pressure changes and turbine power changes. The flow compensation is determined based on valve position and total flow demand, reducing pressure excursions during testing. The method involves test compensation circuits that adjust flow through parallel valves to minimize flow disturbance when one valve is closed for testing. Testing of the method showed a significant reduction in pressure excursions compared to traditional methods. </summary>

The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that allows for continuous adjustment of the mixture of soap solution and water, ranging from 0% soap solution to 100% soap solution. The valve system maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages by reducing the flow rate of the fluids and limiting the maximum flow rate when the bores are not axially aligned with the fluid communication passages.

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and feeding it back into the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure. The invention aims to reduce investments and operational risks. The method includes compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it through heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure. The compressor station includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and electronic controls. The method allows for efficient operation throughout the year, with different configurations for summer and winter operation. The use of expansion turbines for pressure reduction and energy recovery is recommended. The invention offers cost savings, increased plant availability, and reduced safety risks compared to conventional cooling methods.</summary>

<summary> The document discusses the use of cooling fans to prevent overheating of electronic components in various applications. It introduces a system for eliminating traditional fasteners used to secure cooling fans to enclosures, reducing costs and labor. The system involves mounting the cooling fan assembly to a panel using resilient legs that compress and rotate to secure the fan in place. The document also describes the steps for installing the cooling fan assembly and highlights the flexibility of the system for different applications. </summary>

<summary>Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, but lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality. Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to instruments. The present invention introduces damped kinematic mounts with novel damping features to dissipate vibration energy and protect instruments. Two embodiments of damping mechanisms, spherical and cylindrical slot dampers, are described to introduce damping into the mount suspension modes. The damped mounts use viscoelastic materials to achieve modal damping values one to two orders of magnitude greater than existing designs. The mounts can be incorporated into existing structures, use six identical strut elements to reduce manufacturing complexity, and rearrange the strut configuration to uncouple mount suspension modes. The proposed mounting scheme provides a center-of-gravity mounting system with approximately uncoupled modes to protect instruments from dynamic disturbances.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a clutch unit of the oil shear type, particularly for large size power transmission requirements such as in aircraft catapult systems. The clutch unit features interleaved clutch plates and discs with separate piston and cylinder means for each set, providing maximum torque transmission and minimal residual drag. The design also allows for easy removal and replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit. </summary>

<summary> The invention discloses a system of multiple cylinders, including combustion and expansion cylinders, designed to maximize thermal-to-mechanical efficiency and reduce heat loss. The system incorporates water injection, multiple cascading expansion cylinders, water recovery systems, and catalytic materials to optimize energy extraction and reduce emissions. By utilizing innovative design features and technologies, the system aims to eliminate the need for a radiator, achieve high thermal efficiency, and minimize environmental impact. </summary>

<summary> The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel for welding and heat treatment to achieve parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce deformability. The precoat consists of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, with the removal area being 20-40% wider than half the width of the weld. After welding, the welded blanks undergo heat treatment to form an intermetallic alloy compound for corrosion protection and are then hot-deformed and cooled to achieve the desired mechanical properties. The method results in parts with satisfactory ductility, good corrosion resistance, and a total elongation across the welded joint greater than or equal to 4%. The process is suitable for automotive safety parts and ensures the absence of harmful intermetallic areas within the welded joints. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a SCADA system for remote control and navigation of a mobile structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns. It incorporates algorithms to optimize efficiency by analyzing weather data and sensor inputs to adjust the operation of the structure. The system includes computer servers gathering data from GPS, weather satellites, and other sources to make navigation decisions. It allows for remote control of various energy extraction systems, including sailing vessels and propelled structures, in hazardous environments. The system uses electromechanical circuits to control mechanisms such as rudders, propellers, and sails based on data inputs. The GUI on client workstations allows human operators to interact with the system, adjusting navigation plans and monitoring vessel performance. Overall, the system enables efficient and safe energy extraction from offshore marine environments through automated navigation and control. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least two flat material ring segments joined and welded together. The ring segments are punched out from a sheet metal material and connected via joint contours forming an undercut geometry. The method involves welding the ring segments together before forming the axial profiling, reducing material waste and production costs. The resulting rolling body guide cage can be used in various bearing applications, such as groove ball bearings and axial ball roller bearings. </summary>

<summary> The present methods and systems focus on using global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with telecommunications service locations. Efficient customer service is crucial in the telecommunications industry to maintain market share. The lack of specific service location information can lead to delays and missed customer commitments. Methods and systems are needed to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates for customer service locations. These coordinates can be used to direct service technicians to customer locations with minimal time lost. Additionally, directions between multiple service locations can be generated to further enhance response time. The system includes an input device for technicians, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system. The mapping system provides driving directions based on the obtained coordinates. Computer-readable media embodiments are also provided for these methods and systems. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The system processes signals from the sensors to create virtual sensor signals representing the amplitude of the interfering field at the object's location. Independent control loops then modify these signals to generate control signals for the coils. The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous fields, and can handle feedback effects when two systems are operated adjacent to each other. The control algorithms used are flexible and can be tailored to different applications. Experimental determination of feedback matrix elements allows for effective compensation in dual system setups. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where resonance sites are furnished by a bioorthogonal reaction with at least one reaction partner. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes. This method allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, improving specificity and increasing the scattering cross section. By tagging non-resonant background with resonance sites, a stable and reproducible background signal can be generated. The method involves coupling intrinsic chemical structures of the sample with reaction partners to create resonance sites, which can then be detected using CARS microscopy. </summary>

The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from different sources in radiation therapy, comparing volume models to identify missing or extra elements, and using custom metric methods to evaluate conformance. The system can be used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation routines, and assessing new treatment plans based on changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.

<summary> The invention relates to accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating point operations by calculating a subset difference in operand exponent arguments. This subset difference allows for the initiation of the subtraction operation before the complete difference between exponent arguments is determined. By selecting the subset carefully, the correct resulting fraction can be identified based on the available operand fractions. The apparatus for implementing this technique includes detection and logic units to determine the correct procedure for calculating the final fraction result. Overall, the invention aims to reduce the time required to execute floating point operations by accelerating the effective subtraction process. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method of tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility to reduce mislabeling errors. The method involves storing unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, orders for specimens, specimen-taker IDs, and specimen containers. The computer system tracks the relationship between these codes and generates signals to acquire and store specimens in the correct containers. The system ensures that the patient, order, specimen-taker, and specimen container are all related to the same patient to avoid errors. The method includes barcode scanning, time tracking, and error alerts to ensure accurate specimen collection and processing. The system eliminates the need for vial labels and reduces the risk of mislabeling in specimen collection processes.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, utilizing GPS and voice recognition technology. It provides distance and other information verbally to the user. The device can be incorporated into headgear or other portable devices. It also includes features such as predicting golf strategy, club selection, and providing pre-recorded golf instructions. The device may use Bluetooth technology for data transfers and audio communication. Additionally, it allows users to record geographic coordinates of golf courses using GPS technology. Overall, the device offers a convenient and innovative solution for golfers and other outdoor enthusiasts. </summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a system and method for accurately checking design rules in semiconductor integrated circuits, particularly for systems with mixed logic and memory circuits. By creating customized design rules based on modifying standard logic rules, the system can accurately detect real errors in different regions of the IC layout. This approach eliminates false errors caused by applying the same set of rules to all regions. The system categorizes errors by different circuit types, such as logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM, ensuring accurate error detection. The method can be applied to any mask pattern data, including those with multiple types of memory blocks, and is applicable to various industries beyond semiconductor manufacturing. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for controlled illumination of objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators, providing high diffraction efficiencies and compact, rugged arrangements. The system utilizes thin substrate waveguides optically coupled to coherent light sources, allowing for selective and efficient illumination of demanding objects with minimal space requirements. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to detect defects. The method and apparatus involve magnetizing the rotor, sensing induced voltages, and determining resistance, reactance, and skew. Prior art methods include using stator cores or destructive testing techniques. The test apparatus includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means. The data acquisition and processing system acquires and processes data to determine resistance, reactance, and skew values. The control processor compares the values to predetermined thresholds to determine pass/fail status and stores statistical information for analysis. The test fixture includes a retractable spindle with a clutch mechanism to securely hold the rotor during testing. The invention provides an efficient and reliable method for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources to managed libraries with validated digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications without proper authorization. The process involves receiving, verifying, and storing executables in digitally signed containers, ensuring type-safe code and restricting access to premium resources based on certificates. The document also outlines the validation of managed dependencies and the transmission of digitally signed containers to mobile devices for execution. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers. Traditional smart cards with rigid cores can be damaged easily, leading to increased production costs. The new design uses shock-absorbing layers and rigid outer layers to protect the electronic components from damage. The process involves pre-shrinking core and bottom layers, printing indicia, attaching antennae and IC chips, and laminating the layers together. The resulting identification card is durable, easy to manufacture, and provides improved protection for the electronic components. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory using a tree-shaped structure. Updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating. A header node is added to the structure to improve efficiency, allowing for faster additions and deletions. The header node includes an inversion bit to indicate the direction of the queue. The queue can be inverted in constant time and space. The structure allows for symmetrical use as a double-ended queue. The memory arrangement includes control logic, intermediate registers, and a flag register to maintain the queue. The invention provides a more efficient way to implement a FIFO queue in a memory. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to embedded EPROM devices manufactured using existing IC technologies, such as DRAM technology. By utilizing DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, EPROM devices can be built on the same wafer as DRAM devices without adding manufacturing costs. The EPROM devices of the present invention have higher gate coupling ratios and lower operation voltages compared to current art EPROM devices. Additionally, the invention introduces stress effect programmable read only memory (SEPROM) devices, which store data by utilizing transistor damages caused by electrical stresses. SEPROM devices offer advantages such as low cost, high data storage capacity, and security features for embedded applications. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control systems. The method involves provisionally determining feedback gain values, executing feedback control, detecting errors, calculating evaluation values, and repeating the process to determine suitable feedback gain values. The evaluation values are based on stability, accuracy, and response of the control system. The method allows for quick and accurate determination of feedback gain values for optimal control characteristics. The method can be applied to various control systems, such as automatic guidance vehicles. The process involves running the system along a predetermined course and adjusting feedback gains based on evaluation functions. The method provides a practical and efficient way to determine feedback gain values for feedback control systems.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing physical size for use in photographic and video cameras. The zoom lens design addresses the need for high relative aperture in video cameras with low sensitivity image pickup elements. By satisfying specific conditions for lens construction and arrangement, the zoom lens achieves a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end. The design of the fourth and fifth lens units plays a crucial role in correcting aberrations and achieving high optical performance. The invention allows for a significant reduction in the total length of the zoom lens system while maintaining excellent optical quality.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector by generating charge pulses and converting them into electric signals. The method allows for the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals at high count rates without prior knowledge of expected signal rates. By tapping signals on the low-voltage side of the detector and using fast and slow amplifiers, the detection and evaluation of small-size signals is improved. The device can be used in various applications such as particle accelerators, medical imaging, and electrical power engineering. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings, a torque motor connected to a splined hub for rotating the driven disc assembly, and sensors for measuring distances and rotation. The program executed by a microprocessor controls the operation of the torque motor and servo motor to gradually reduce frictional force on the driven disc assembly. If the assembly rotates a predetermined amount, it is considered good; if not, it is considered bad. The apparatus provides external indications to the operator of the test results and allows for statistical process control. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to face age-estimation methods, systems, and software. The invention utilizes a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images. The method involves training a system with a database of faces with assigned landmark points and known ages. Support Vector Regression and Support Vector Machines are used to construct aging functions and an age classifier. The system then classifies a face as youth or adult and applies the appropriate aging function to estimate the age of the face. The estimated age, along with confidence factors, is provided as output. The system can be implemented on a computing system with various components for processing image data and generating age estimates. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, such as a high definition image and a lower definition image. The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements, with some pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and others to displaying the second image. Different embodiments are described, including arrangements with different numbers of pixels and color combinations. The device can be used for applications like combining night vision and infrared images, with the ability to correct intensity levels for better visibility. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system, with a removable payment element for cashless transactions. The payment element can be securely stored in the transmitter, allowing communication with the security system in both normal and secure states. A closure protects the receptacle when the payment element is removed, ensuring functionality and preventing damage to the electronics. </summary>

<summary> An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may become inactive and enter a sleep mode to save energy. However, prolonged inactivity can lead to a decrease in the tribo charge of the toner, affecting image quality. To address this issue, intelligent methods for adjusting the toner charge based on periods of inactivity are proposed. These methods involve predicting user usage patterns, measuring toner charge levels, and adjusting the toner charge to ensure consistent image quality during printing operations.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus capable of controlling bias currents for MR heads and recording heads with high precision using a single control line. The apparatus allows for independent regulation of bias currents for multiple heads mounted on a rotary drum, ensuring stable data recording and reproduction. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of adjacent objects. It improves upon prior art techniques by using a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects. A receiver senses magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields. The system allows for easier and more accurate locating and tracing of buried objects, even when multiple objects are present. Different techniques, such as using different carrier frequencies or modulation frequencies, are employed to distinguish the currents in the objects. The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects to produce distinct output signal characteristics. The invention is especially useful when the horizontal separation between objects is related to the depth of the object to be located. Changes can be made to the embodiments without departing from the principles of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to allow hands-free automatic answering and communication. It includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the call and a bypass switch for extending the call duration. The system can be used in various settings, such as for the physically handicapped or in business environments, and can be easily connected to existing telephone systems.
